title: 6 Easy Ways to See Your IP Address on PC, Mac, Android & iOS

steps.title: Your public IP address is visible to people outside of your home or office network.
steps.content: Your public IP address is visible to people outside of your home or office network. When you browse the internet, download files, or stream music, remote servers can see your public IP address. Because of how most home and office networks are set up, all of the devices (computers, printers, phones, etc.) connected to the internet through the same router will appear to have the same public IP address to the outside world. [1] X Research source Other people on the internet can see your public IP address. For example, if you connect to a friend's Minecraft server from your PC, your friend will see the connection coming from your public IP address. Some reasons you might need your public IP address: Hosting a game or media server, you want to allow someone to connect to your computer remotely, or you're just curious about the address that identifies you on the internet. If you're concerned about your public IP address identifying you on the internet, you can use a VPN to be more anonymous .

steps.title: Your device's private IP address identifies it on your local network.
steps.content: Your device's private IP address identifies it on your local network. A private IP address is assigned to each device by your router and is not visible to or reachable from outside of the network. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 10 June 2020. Each device (such as your phone, computer, and printer) has its own unique private IP address on the network, even though they'll all appear to have the same IP address to the outside world. [3] X Research source Some reasons you might need your private IP address: Setting up file sharing , port forwarding on a router, and adding devices to your home network. Your router also has its own private IP address, which is called the default gateway. Check out our guide on finding your router's IP address if you need to make changes to your router.

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com in any web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com in any web browser. The easiest way to see your public IP address on any device, such as on your computer, Android, iPhone, or iPad, is to use this handy web browser trick.

steps.title: Type What's my IP address?
steps.content: Type What's my IP address? and press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . You can also type a different variation of that phrase, such as "my IP address" or "What's my IP?"

steps.title: Find your public IP address at the top of the page.
steps.content: Find your public IP address at the top of the page. At the top of the page, you'll see your IPv4 or IPv6 IP address. An IPv4 IP address is a 4-octet number address, which will look something like this: 107.178.192.0 An iPv6 IP address is longer and may contain both letters and numbers. For example: 2001:0db8:3c4d:0015:0000:0000:1a2f:1a2b If you're checking your public IP address on a phone that's connected to the internet through your mobile provider's data plan, you'll see the public IP address assigned to you by your mobile phone provider. If you're connected to Wi-Fi , you'll see the public IP address of your Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Press the Windows key on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press the Windows key on your keyboard. This will open the Start menu or screen on Windows 11, Windows 10, and Windows 8. [4] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 10 June 2020. On Windows 7 and earlier, you can select the Command Prompt from the Start menu and then skip to Step 3.

steps.title: Type "cmd" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "cmd" and press ↵ Enter . This opens a Command Prompt window. [5] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 10 June 2020.

steps.title: Type ipconfig and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type ipconfig and press ↵ Enter . This will display all of your networking information. [6] X Research source You may have to expand the Command Prompt window to see it all. [7] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 10 June 2020.

steps.title: Find your private IP address under your wireless or ethernet adapter.
steps.content: Find your private IP address under your wireless or ethernet adapter. If you're connected to the internet using Wi-Fi, you'll find your IP address under the "Wireless LAN adapter Wi-Fi" heading. If you have a wired ethernet connection, you'll find the IP address under the "Ethernet adapter" heading. If your network is using IPv4, which is most common, you'll see the IP address next to "IPv4 Address." If your network is using IPv6, your IPv6 address will appear next to "Link-local IPv6 Address." If you have both an IPv4 and IPv6 IP address listed, the address you're looking for is likely the IPv4 address.

steps.title: Other ways to find your private IP address on Windows.
steps.content: Other ways to find your private IP address on Windows. While the previous steps will work on all versions of Windows, you can also use these operating system-specific steps to quickly view your IP address : Windows 11: Click the Windows Start menu, go to Settings > Network & internet , choose either Wi-Fi or Ethernet , and find your IP address under "Properties." [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Windows 10: Click the network icon on your taskbar—it'll be the Wi-Fi bar symbol or a small computer. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Click your connection. If you're connected to Wi-Fi, select the Wi-Fi network name. For ethernet, choose your ethernet network. Find your IP address under "Properties."

steps.title: Open your System Settings (Ventura and later) or System Preferences (Monterey and earlier).
steps.content: Open your System Settings (Ventura and later) or System Preferences (Monterey and earlier). Depending on your version of macOS, you'll find one of these two options in the Apple menu at the top-left corner of your screen. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click Network.
steps.content: Click Network . On macOS Ventura, you'll see this in the left panel. On Monterey and earlier, it'll be an icon in the System Preferences window. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Select your network connection.
steps.content: Select your network connection. For example, if you're connected to Wi-Fi, choose that option. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Find your IP address.
steps.content: Find your IP address. If you're using macOS Monterey or earlier, you'll see your IP address in the right panel. On Ventura or later, click Details under your connection in the right panel to display your IP address. On much older versions of OS X, you'll need to click the "TCP/IP" tab at the top of the window to see the "IP Address" entry.

steps.title: Open a Terminal window.
steps.content: Open a Terminal window. You can easily view your Linux computer's IP address with simple commands. Start by opening a Terminal , which you can usually do by pressing Ctrl + Alt + T . [13] X Research source If you're using Ubuntu Linux, you can also pull up your IP address without having to type commands. Just go to Activities overview, type settings , click Settings , select your connection type (e.g., Wi-Fi or Network > PCI Ethernet ), and then click the gear icon next to your connection. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Type hostname -i and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type hostname -i and press ↵ Enter . This displays the private IP address on your Linux desktop or server. [15] X Research source While the ifconfig command used to be used to display IP info, the command is now deprecated.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . You'll find this in your app list, as well as in your quick settings.

steps.title: Tap Network & Internet.
steps.content: Tap Network & Internet . Because all Android interfaces are a little different, the name of the Settings option you're looking for may vary. This section may also be called Wireless & Networks .

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi . If you don't see this option, tap Internet instead. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the wireless network you're connected to.
steps.content: Tap the wireless network you're connected to. On some Androids, you'll now see the IP address. If you don't see it, continue to the next step. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Advanced or Configure if the IP address isn't visible.
steps.content: Tap Advanced or Configure if the IP address isn't visible. If you don't see one of these options, tap the three dots at the top-right corner first.

steps.title: Find your IP address next to "IP Address."
steps.content: Find your IP address next to "IP Address." You might have to scroll down to see it. [18] X Research source If these steps don't work for your Android, try opening Settings , and then tap About phone > Status . You can also try System > About phone > Status .

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . You'll find this app on your Home screen or in your app library. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi . You'll see it near the top of the menu. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ⓘ icon next to your wireless network.
steps.content: Tap the ⓘ icon next to your wireless network. It's the small "i" inside of a circle. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down to the "IP Address" section.
steps.content: Scroll down to the "IP Address" section. This will display your iPhone's IP address on your local Wi-Fi network.
